nReaderThread

private int nReaderThread(int fd)
Native method is a loop that monitors port data availability status. It manages the ring buffer including framing characters, parity, break, and signals the other native code components accordingly.

Parameters:
fd -

setFlowControlMode

public void setFlowControlMode(int FlowControl)
                        throws UnsupportedCommOperationException
Set flow control information. Any combination of the following can be set.

Specified by:
setFlowControlMode in class SerialPort
Parameters:
FlowControl - int

FLOWCONTROL_NONE: no flow control

FLOWCONTROL_RTSCTS_IN: RTS/CTS(hardware) flowcontrol for input

FLOWCONTROL_RTSCTS_OUT: RTS/CTS(hardware) flowcontrol for output

FLOWCONTROL_XONXOFF_IN: XON/XOFF(software)flowcontrol for input

FLOWCONTROL_XONXOFF_OUT: XON/XOFF(software) flowcontrol for outp

Throws:
UnsupportedCommOperationException - if any of the flow control mode was not supported by the underline OS, or if input and output flow control are set to different values, i.e. one hardware and one software. The flow control mode will revert to the value before the call was made.

getFlowControlMode

public int getFlowControlMode()
Get flow control mode information

Specified by:
getFlowControlMode in class SerialPort
Returns:
int Flow control type set for port
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException

setSerialPortParams

public void setSerialPortParams(int baud,
                                int databits,
                                int stopbits,
                                int parity)
                         throws UnsupportedCommOperationException
Set serial port parameters.

DEFAULT: 9600 baud, 8 databits, 1 stopbit, no parity

Specified by:
setSerialPortParams in class SerialPort
Parameters:
baud - int 2400, 4800, 9600, 19200, 28800, 38400, 57600, 115200
or closest legal value for that particular port.

databits - int
    DATABITS_5: 5 bits

    DATABITS_6: 6 bits

    DATABITS_7: 7 bits

    DATABITS_8: 8 bits

stopbits - int
    STOPBITS_1: 1 stop bit

    STOPBITS_2: 2 stop bits

    STOPBITS_1_5: 1.5 stop bits

parity - int
    PARITY_NONE: no parity

    PARITY_ODD: odd parity

    PARITY_EVEN: even parity

Throws:
UnsupportedCommOperationException
java.lang.IllegalStateException

addEventListener

public void addEventListener(SerialPortEventListener lsnr)
                      throws java.util.TooManyListenersException
This method is used to register a listener for serial port events. Interest in specific events may be expressed using the notifyOnXXX calls described below. The serialEvent method of SerialPortEventListener will be called with a SerialEvent object describing the event. UNDONE: Implement a multicaster

enableReceiveThreshold

public void enableReceiveThreshold(int thresh)
                            throws UnsupportedCommOperationException


Defaults to 100 byte reads at a time. This setting may not behave in the expected manner, UNDONE: Check on expected behavior of this setting.

Currently, the receive threshold is the number of bytes read in a single serial-port access (i.e. JNI read() call).

Specified by:
enableReceiveThreshold in class CommPort
Parameters:
thresh - int Number of bytes to read at time from port.
Throws:
UnsupportedCommOperationException - is thrown if receive threshold is not supported by the underlying driver.

disableReceiveThreshold

public void disableReceiveThreshold()
Disable receive threshold.

Specified by:
disableReceiveThreshold in class CommPort
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException

enableReceiveTimeout

public void enableReceiveTimeout(int rcvTimeout)
                          throws UnsupportedCommOperationException
Set the receive timeout value for a port. When this many milliseconds have elapsed blocking read return immediately regardless of number of bytes in input buffer.

NOTE: This implementation rounds to the next highest increment of 100 milliseconds (the smallest granularity acceptable).

Specified by:
enableReceiveTimeout in class CommPort
Parameters:
rcvTimeout - int Timeout value
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException
UnsupportedCommOperationException - is thrown if receive timeout is not supported by the underlying driver.

disableReceiveTimeout

public void disableReceiveTimeout()
Disable receive timeout status.

Specified by:
disableReceiveTimeout in class CommPort

isReceiveTimeoutEnabled

nSetFramingByte

private void nSetFramingByte(int fd,
                             int framingByte)
Native method to set framing byte.

A framing byte character in the input stream suggests the end of the received frame.

setInputBufferSize

public void setInputBufferSize(int size)
Set and get the input and output buffer sizes.

Note that these are also advisory and memory availability may determine the ultimate buffer sizes used by the driver.
